Class Utility

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utility

  • public class Utility
extends java.lang.Object

    Utility

    This class contains all the methods that pull information for the FrontEnd class to build the program.

    Last updated 6/20/23

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Utility()

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<PositionPlayer> generateHitterArray(java.io.File file)
      This method takes in a csv file of hitter info and generates and returns an arrayList of position players.
      static java.util.ArrayList<Pitcher> generatePitcherArray(java.io.File file)
      This method takes in a csv file of pitcher info and generates and returns an arrayList of pitchers.
      static java.lang.String[][] generateTeamTranslateArray()
      This Method generates a translate array that is used to swap between the full and abbreviated team name.
      static java.lang.String[][] getHittingStatLeaders(java.util.ArrayList<PositionPlayer> hitters, java.lang.String stat, java.lang.String league, java.lang.String team, int minPA)
      This method generates a 2d String array that contains a list of position player's names and a specified stat, sorted by that stat, either ascending or descending depending on the stat.
      static Pitcher getPitcher(java.util.ArrayList<Pitcher> list, java.lang.String name)
      This method takes in an arrayList of pitchers and a target pitcher's name and returns the Pitcher object from the list.
      static java.lang.String[][] getPitchingStatLeaders(java.util.ArrayList<Pitcher> pitchers, java.lang.String stat, java.lang.String league, java.lang.String team, double minIP)
      This method generates a 2d String array that contains a list of pitcher's names and a specified stat, sorted by that stat, either ascending or descending depending on the stat.
      static PositionPlayer getPositionPlayer(java.util.ArrayList<PositionPlayer> list, java.lang.String name)
      This method takes in an arrayList of position players and a target hitter's name and returns the PositionPlayer object from the list.
      static int identifyPlayerType(Pitcher pitcher, PositionPlayer hitter)
      This method takes in a Pitcher and PositionPlayer and returns a number that indicates if the player is a pitcher, position player, or a two way player.
      static java.lang.String[][] reverseLeaders(java.lang.String[][] originalOrder)
      This method takes in a 2d string and returns a new string that is identical, but reversed.

                                                         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method takes in a csv file of pitcher info and generates and returns an arrayList of pitchers.
        Parameters:
        file - (File; csv file that accesses the needed stats)
        Returns:
        pitchersList (ArrayList; list of all the Pitcher objects)
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • identifyPlayerType

        public static int identifyPlayerType(Pitcher pitcher,
                                     PositionPlayer hitter)
        This method takes in a Pitcher and PositionPlayer and returns a number that indicates if the player is a pitcher, position player, or a two way player.
        Parameters:
        pitcher - (Pitcher; Pitcher to check type of player)
        hitter - (PositionPlayer; to check the type of player)
        Returns:
        playerType (int; indicates the type of player)

      • generateTeamTranslateArray

        public static java.lang.String[][] generateTeamTranslateArray()
        This Method generates a translate array that is used to swap between the full and abbreviated team name.
        Returns:
        translateArray[][] (String[][]; list of full and abbreviated team names)

      • getPitchingStatLeaders

        public static java.lang.String[][] getPitchingStatLeaders(java.util.ArrayList<Pitcher> pitchers,
                                                          java.lang.String stat,
                                                          java.lang.String league,
                                                          java.lang.String team,
                                                          double minIP)
        This method generates a 2d String array that contains a list of pitcher's names and a specified stat, sorted by that stat, either ascending or descending depending on the stat. It also builds the array with or without filters depending on user input.
        Parameters:
        pitchers - (ArrayList; array list of pitchers used to build the leaders array)
        stat - (String; name of the target stat selected by the user.)
        league - (String; name of the league used to filter the list.)
        team - (String; name of the team used to filter the list.)
        minIP - (double; amount of minimum innings pitched given by the user. Defaults to 0 if nothing entered)
        Returns:
        leaders (String[][]; filtered list of pitchers and the target stat, sorted by the target stat)

      • reverseLeaders

        public static java.lang.String[][] reverseLeaders(java.lang.String[][] originalOrder)
        This method takes in a 2d string and returns a new string that is identical, but reversed.
        Parameters:
        originalOrder - (String[][]; list in original order)
        Returns:
        reversedOrder (String[][]; reversed list)

      • getHittingStatLeaders

        public static java.lang.String[][] getHittingStatLeaders(java.util.ArrayList<PositionPlayer> hitters,
                                                         java.lang.String stat,
                                                         java.lang.String league,
                                                         java.lang.String team,
                                                         int minPA)
        This method generates a 2d String array that contains a list of position player's names and a specified stat, sorted by that stat, either ascending or descending depending on the stat. It also builds the array with or without filters depending on user input.
        Parameters:
        hitters - (ArrayList; array list of hitters used to build the leaders array)
        stat - (String; name of the target stat selected by the user.)
        league - (String; name of the league used to filter the list.)
        team - (String; name of the team used to filter the list.)
        minPA - (int; amount of minimum plate appearances given by the user. Defaults to 0 if nothing entered)

      • getPitcher

        public static Pitcher getPitcher(java.util.ArrayList<Pitcher> list,
                                 java.lang.String name)
        This method takes in an arrayList of pitchers and a target pitcher's name and returns the Pitcher object from the list.
        Parameters:
        list - (ArrayList; list of all Pitchers.
        name - (String; name of the target player)
        Returns:
        Pitcher
